definition: to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad

sentences.english: How meaningful are your likes and what are the impacts of your dislikes?
sentences.chinese: 你的喜惡分別有多重要的影響？

sentences.english: As you know, ma'am, different nations have different preferences and abhorrences.
sentences.chinese: 女士，您知道吧，不同的民族有不同的喜惡。

sentences.english: You need to know the likes and dislikes of your partner.
sentences.chinese: 你需要知道的喜惡，你的合作伙伴。

sentences.english: Influence comes in many forms we don't have to like it to recognise it.
sentences.chinese: 影響力有很多形式，不以他人的喜惡爲轉移。

sentences.english: In the history, Asian mainly kill human for fun and anger.
sentences.chinese: 歷史上，很多亞洲人因喜惡來互相殺戮，並以此爲樂。

sentences.english: Laura is a very passionate person who has strong likes and dislikes .
sentences.chinese: 蘿拉是個非常熱情的人，擁有強烈的喜惡。

definition: to convert an enemy into a friend (idiom)
see 泰然處之|泰然处之[tai4 ran2 chu3 zhi1]
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to be content with what one is
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
long sleeves help one dance beautifully (idiom); money and power will help you in any occupation
